resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.

fields.summary: MR AM unable to load native library without MR_AM_ADMIN_USER_ENV set

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

fields.summary: Update MRJobConfig.DEFAULT_MAPRED_ADMIN_USER_ENV value for loading correct navite lib when using ubertask feature

This message was automatically generated.

This patch is different from MAPREDUCE-6577.
The key point is as below.
In fact the parameters yarn.app.mapreduce.am.env and yarn.app.mapreduce.am.admin.user.env are resolved in YARNRunner running on {color:red}*hadoop client host*{color}.
But their values, e.g. LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/lib/native, will be used on hadoop cluster hosts.
If the hadoop client host installs hadoop on a {color:red}*different path*{color} from that on hadoop cluster hosts,
the $HADOOP_COMMON_HOME/lib/native will be resolved to a path which is not existed on hadoop cluster hosts.
Then MRAppMaster running on hadoop cluster host cannot load native lib.

I agree with Gera that this is a duplicate.  The recent patches for MAPREDUCE-6577 addressed the variables being resolved on the client, with the caveat that there's a lingering Windows-specific problem being tracked by MAPREDUCE-6588.
